<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/01/hack-shuts-jbs-meat-processing-operations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Cyber Drama at the Meat Market
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/01/hack-shuts-jbs-meat-processing-operations" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of a standing cow in front of a beige background. The cow's head and front of its body are in clear focus, but it's back legs and butt fade are pixelated and blurred.. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzA1L2Nvdy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over the weekend, hackers hit the only piece of American infrastructure more critical than the Colonial Pipeline: the burger supply. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">JBS, the world's largest meat processor, had to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/cyber-attack-hits-jbs-meat-works-australia-north-america-2021-05-31/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down</a> North American and Australian operations Monday following a coordinated ransomware attack. The company told the White House that it believes a criminal organization based in Russia is behind the hack.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the US, which <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-31/meat-is-latest-cyber-victim-as-hackers-hit-top-supplier-jbs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accounts for</a> half of JBS revenues, nearly 20% of beef production was impacted by temporary plant shutdowns. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It does appear to be temporary, though. </strong>JBS said that the "vast majority" of its facilities would be operational today due to progress it made in resolving the attack. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If operations had remain paused for days or weeks, the hiccup could've turned into a real headache for JBS customers like supermarkets and fast-food chains that require a continuous supply of meat. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Extra bad timing</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While wholesale meat prices remained mostly stable yesterday, extended disruption from the cyberattack threatened to send meat prices—already <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/05/29/beef-pork-retail-prices-skyrocket/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on the rise</a>—soaring even higher. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Compared to 2020, April's pork and beef prices were up 4.8% and 3.3%, respectively, due to labor shortages, restaurant reopenings, rising grain and transportation costs, and high demand for meat exports. And Memorial Day weekend just kicked off the summer grilling season, which means even more demand for meat in the US.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>As a greater proportion of corporate operations are tied to IT systems, hackers are presented with more opportunities to prey on links in critical supply chains. The JBS incident comes just weeks after hackers forced the shutdown of the Colonial Pipeline and disrupted gas supplies up the East Coast. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/01/amc-raises-millions-acquire-theaters?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
AMC Plans for Worldwide Domination
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Propelled by Reddit traders, AMC <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/amc-theatres-raises-million-acquisitions-investments-1234961260/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has landed</a> on the moon and discovered it's made of movie theater nacho cheese. Following a remarkable 1,100% gain in share price this year, the chain raised more than $230 million to acquire other theaters, such as the former Arclight Cinemas and Pacific Theatres.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Did AMC find a $230 million bill in the laundry or…?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">AMC issued 8.5 million shares to investment firm Mudrick Capital to raise the sum. According to Bloomberg, Mudrick <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-01/mudrick-said-to-sell-entire-amc-stake-calling-shares-overvalued?utm_source=twitter&utm_content=business&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&cmpid=socialflow-twitter-business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">immediately sold off</a> all of its freshly purchased shares after deeming the stock overvalued (wait until they hear about movie theater popcorn).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mudrick bought its shares at $27.12 and, if it had sold them when the stock hit a high of $33.53 yesterday, it could have raked in around $40 million.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote du jour: </strong>AMC<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>CEO Adam Aron said, "With our increased liquidity, an increasingly vaccinated population, and the imminent release of blockbuster new movie titles, it is time for AMC to go on the offense again."</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">

IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/01/krispy-kreme-files-go-public?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Homer Simpson Approves of This IPO
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/01/krispy-kreme-files-go-public" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Glazed donuts" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=376 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fp1wbNlFeSJ20/giphy.gif">

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Glazed donuts" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fp1wbNlFeSJ20/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Krispy Kreme filed <a href="https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/financing/krispy-kreme-files-its-100m-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to go public</a> yesterday under the ticker symbol DNUT, a much better choice than KRPY but less creative than GLZD.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Consider this a comeback tour, because when the 83-year-old chain first went public in 2000, it filed for bankruptcy just five years later—when carbs became public enemy No. 1.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But after being battered and fried, Krispy Kreme was picked up by European investment firm JAB Holdings and glazed back to glory. Some notable stats from Krispy Kreme's <a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1857154/000119312521177720/d107564ds1.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SEC filing</a>…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>US sales grew 17% in its last fiscal year, and net revenue jumped 23% in Q1 2021 year over year.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The chain expanded its footprint from 6,040 Krispy Kreme-selling locations in 2019 to 8,275 last year. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Did you know: Krispy Kreme owns Insomnia Cookies, which conducts over half of its sales via e-commerce. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>64% of all Krispy Kreme donuts sold are the glazed kind, because that's the best flavor.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>JAB Holdings <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/01/business/krispy-kreme-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recently sent</a> another chain it owned, JDE Peets (which runs Peet's Coffee, Stumptown, and more), into the public markets and has been prepping a similar fate for Panera.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/01/oil-prices-surge-highest-levels-since-covid-began?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Down 28–3, Oil Stages a Comeback
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, oil prices hit their <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/01/oil-opec-meeting-in-focus-amid-concerns-over-iranian-oil-supply.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest levels</a> since the pandemic began. The international benchmark, Brent crude, closed above $70/barrel for the first time since May 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>The powerful oil cartel OPEC and its allies agreed to gradually increase oil production. That announcement, signaling more demand for fuel in the coming months, only added to the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/oil-rallies-to-highest-in-two-years-as-stockpiles-shrink-11622549154?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">positive vibes</a> around the price of oil, which has shot up more than 30% this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>In spring 2020, demand for fuel collapsed when the pandemic halted travel. Oil producers instituted historic supply cuts because, hey, why make fuel when no one's going anywhere? At one point the price of oil plunged into <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/27/one-type-oil-sells-negative-prices?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">negative territory</a>—meaning someone would pay you to take possession of their oil barrel. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The fast and furious economic recovery has changed the narrative in the oil industry from totally gutted to cautiously optimistic. But the big wild card is Iran: If the country rejoins the nuclear deal with the US, which is under consideration, it will play a significant role in global oil production.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/01/key-performance-indicators-june-2?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stats: </strong>Three stats that illustrate the travel industry's rebound.</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>American Airlines expects </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/business-travel-is-coming-back-11622547001?mod=hp_lead_pos10" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">47 of its top 50 corporate accounts</a></span><span> to start traveling again this year in a promising sign for business travel, per the WSJ.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>TSA screened </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/01/us-air-travel-reaches-pandemic-high-as-peak-season-kicks-off.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 2 million passengers</a></span><span> at US airports on Friday, the most since the pandemic began.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Hilton's CEO said that Saturday night of Memorial Day weekend was the </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/01/travel-bookings-are-rebounding-as-hilton-has-best-night-since-the-beginning-of-the-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">busiest</a></span><span> its hotels have been in the Covid era. 93% of rooms were occupied.  </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“For much too long, the history of what took place here was told in silence.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Biden was in Tulsa, OK, yesterday to mark the 100th anniversary of the massacre that left 300 people dead and destroyed the neighborhood known as Black Wall Street. He also unveiled <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/06/01/us/biden-news-tulsa?utm_source=morning_brew#biden-tulsa-black-businesses-homeowners" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new initiatives</a> aimed at narrowing the racial wealth gap.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A profile of the Pied Piper of SPACs, Chamath Palihapitiya. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2021/06/07/the-pied-piper-of-spacs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New Yorker</a>)</p>

A handful of people are seen from below swimming in it on a sunny afternoon." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzA2L3NreV9wb29sLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Finally, something to freak out people who are afraid of heights <em>and</em> depths. Suspended 115 ft. above the ground in London, the infamous Sky Pool <a href="https://www.the-sun.com/news/2989862/daredevils-dip-floating-sky-pool-london/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opened</a> for business this week.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">*If you're a resident of the luxury Embassy Gardens' apartment buildings, where apartments start at $850k. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The 82' see-through pool offers a bird's-eye view of the Houses of Parliament, the London Eye, and some very confused pedestrians. Windy out? Don't worry, it also has technology that "allows it to move in high winds."</p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before we get to today's trivia question...we should let you know we had several #fails in yesterday's Nutritional Facts section. First of all, we said that Cheerios was a Nestlé product, when of course it's made by General Mills. To make things worse, we gave the ingredients to Honey Nut Cheerios but said the answer was the OG Cheerios. Overall, a disaster. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let's mercifully move on to today's prompt: Which major US city is depicted here? </p>

The cow's head and front of its body are in clear focus, but it's back legs and butt fade are pixelated and blurred.. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzA1L2Nvdy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver the weekend, hackers hit the only piece of American infrastructure more critical than the Colonial Pipeline: the burger supply. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJBS, the world's largest meat processor, had to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/cyber-attack-hits-jbs-meat-works-australia-north-america-2021-05-31/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down\u003c/a\u003e North American and Australian operations Monday following a coordinated ransomware attack. The company told the White House that it believes a criminal organization based in Russia is behind the hack.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the US, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-31/meat-is-latest-cyber-victim-as-hackers-hit-top-supplier-jbs?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccounts for\u003c/a\u003e half of JBS revenues, nearly 20% of beef production was impacted by temporary plant shutdowns. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt does appear to be temporary, though. \u003c/strong\u003eJBS said that the \"vast majority\" of its facilities would be operational today due to progress it made in resolving the attack. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf operations had remain paused for days or weeks, the hiccup could've turned into a real headache for JBS customers like supermarkets and fast-food chains that require a continuous supply of meat. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eExtra bad timing\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile wholesale meat prices remained mostly stable yesterday, extended disruption from the cyberattack threatened to send meat prices—already \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/05/29/beef-pork-retail-prices-skyrocket/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon the rise\u003c/a\u003e—soaring even higher. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCompared to 2020, April's pork and beef prices were up 4.8% and 3.3%, respectively, due to labor shortages, restaurant reopenings, rising grain and transportation costs, and high demand for meat exports. And Memorial Day weekend just kicked off the summer grilling season, which means even more demand for meat in the US.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAs a greater proportion of corporate operations are tied to IT systems, hackers are presented with more opportunities to prey on links in critical supply chains. The JBS incident comes just weeks after hackers forced the shutdown of the Colonial Pipeline and disrupted gas supplies up the East Coast. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-01/mudrick-said-to-sell-entire-amc-stake-calling-shares-overvalued?utm_source=twitter\u0026amp;utm_content=business\u0026amp;utm_medium=social\u0026amp;utm_campaign=socialflow-organic\u0026amp;cmpid=socialflow-twitter-business\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMudrick bought its shares at $27.12 and, if it had sold them when the stock hit a high of $33.53 yesterday, it could have raked in around $40 million.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote du jour: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eConsider this a comeback tour, because when the 83-year-old chain first went public in 2000, it filed for bankruptcy just five years later—when carbs became public enemy No. 1.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut after being battered and fried, Krispy Kreme was picked up by European investment firm JAB Holdings and glazed back to glory. Some notable stats from Krispy Kreme's \u003ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1857154/000119312521177720/d107564ds1.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUS sales grew 17% in its last fiscal year, and net revenue jumped 23% in Q1 2021 year over year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe chain expanded its footprint from 6,040 Krispy Kreme-selling locations in 2019 to 8,275 last year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDid you know: Krispy Kreme owns Insomnia Cookies, which conducts over half of its sales via e-commerce. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e64% of all Krispy Kreme donuts sold are the glazed kind, because that's the best flavor.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eJAB Holdings \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/01/business/krispy-kreme-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecently sent\u003c/a\u003e another chain it owned, JDE Peets (which runs Peet's Coffee, style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, oil prices hit their \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/01/oil-opec-meeting-in-focus-amid-concerns-over-iranian-oil-supply.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehighest levels\u003c/a\u003e since the pandemic began. The international benchmark, Brent crude, closed above $70/barrel for the first time since May 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eThe powerful oil cartel OPEC and its allies agreed to gradually increase oil production. That announcement, signaling more demand for fuel in the coming months, only added to the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/oil-rallies-to-highest-in-two-years-as-stockpiles-shrink-11622549154?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epositive vibes\u003c/a\u003e around the price of oil, which has shot up more than 30% this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eIn spring 2020, demand for fuel collapsed when the pandemic halted travel. Oil producers instituted historic supply cuts because, hey, why make fuel when no one's going anywhere? At one point the price of oil plunged into \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/27/one-type-oil-sells-negative-prices?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enegative territory\u003c/a\u003e—meaning someone would pay you to take possession of their oil barrel. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe fast and furious economic recovery has changed the narrative in the oil industry from totally gutted to cautiously optimistic. But the big wild card is Iran: If the country rejoins the nuclear deal with the US, which is under consideration, it will play a significant role in global oil production.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!--
